title: Dr
name: Cass Zhixue Zhao
research_areas: Science, Humanities and Social Sciences, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Machine learning, Natural language processing

title: Dr
name: Gavin Boyce
research_areas: Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Human computer interface, Machine learning, Natural language processing, Visualisation
short_biography: I have a background in Philosophy, Computing and Psychology. I currently work as Head of Faculty & Research Partnership in the University of Sheffield library. Day-to-day I head up the small, but perfectly formed, Faculty Engagement team; 12 dedicated specialist librarians who endeavour to support both staff and student needs across all disciplines within the University. Much of my focus is on ensuring that the Library will continue to be the beating heart of the University in five to ten years time and in the current environment this requires a combination of careful long-term planning and fleet-footed opportunism.
research_interest_summary: My PhD thesis was on the topic of Artificial Intelligence, an an interdisciplinary piece of work that had neither the a priori rigour that it takes to satisfy pure philosophers, nor sufficient lines of code to mollify decent computer scientists. I spent my nights working on Yorick Wilkes' Japanese-Electronic dictionary. I have leaned towards AI, HCI and the applications thereof ever since.

title: Dr
name: Giuliano Punzo
research_areas: Data-centric Engineering
research_interest_terms: Automatic control, Mathematical modelling, Multi-agent reasoning
short_biography: Dr Punzo received the BEng and the MEng in aerospace engineer from the University of Naples Federico II and forked for a brief period at Thales Alenia Space (Turin). He started the doctoral studies and was awarded a PhD in Swarm Engineering in 2014 at the University of Strathclyde in Glasgow. Giuliano held research and teaching posts at the University of Strathclyde, the University of Glasgow and The University of Sheffield before becoming a lecturer in Aerospace Systems at the department of Automatic Control and Systems Engineering at the University of Sheffield in 2019.
research_interest_summary: Giulianoâ€™s research interests are in the broad area of control theory and complex systems. His current research aims at understanding complex dynamics at the interface between social and technical systems. These include the use of public services such as transportation or water systems, how these impact the demographic and the resilience of both the infrastructure and the community they serve. Research areas of interest include network theory, control theory, games on networks, consensus, and complexity.

title: Dr
name: Grant Hill
research_areas: Science
research_interest_terms: Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Optimisation, Visualisation
short_biography: I obtained my MChem degree from the University of York in 2002, followed by a PhD in theoretical chemistry from the same institute in 2005. After periods of postdoctoral study in Cardiff and Washington State, I had a temporary position at the University of Glasgow. I joined the University of Sheffield in 2014.
research_interest_summary: I am interested in exploring fundamental questions in chemistry/physics at the molecular level using theoretical and computational tools. Recent areas of focus include the use of data science and machine learning techniques to design new molecules/materials and to improve the methods of quantum chemistry.

title: Dr
name: Grigorios Kyritsakas
research_areas: Data-centric Engineering, Science
research_interest_terms: Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Optimisation, Statistical methods and theory
short_biography: Dr Grigorios Kyritsakas received his MEng in Environmental Engineering from the Technical University of Crete and his Msc in hydrology from Imperial College London. He then worked as a water engineering consultant for a period of 10 years working on the design of water and wastewater treatment plants and distribution systems. He then got back in academia in 2017 to purchase a PhD in data analytics for drinking water quality at University of Sheffield Civil and Structural engineering department. With the completion of his studies in 2021, he stayed in the department as a post-doc research associate working on machine learning application for improving drinking water quality.
research_interest_summary: Grigorio's research interests are in the are of water quality, hydraulics, water infrastructures, and public health. His current research focuses on application of machine learning applications for understanding factors related to water quality deterioration, predicting future deterioration events and improving the quality of the water that is consumed. His research area of interest also includes the digital transformation of the water systems and the application of graph network theory in drinking water distribution systems.

title: Dr
name: Haiping Lu
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Science, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Computer vision, Knowledge representation, Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Multi-agent reasoning, Neuroscience and cognitive science, Statistical methods and theory
short_biography: I am a Senior Lecturer in Machine Learning and AI Strategy Lead at the Department of Computer Science, and Insigneo Research Director for Healthcare Data / AI, University of Sheffield. I am also the Turing Network Development Award Lead at Sheffield and the Machine Learning Theme Lead for Sheffield in the N8 Centre of Excellence in Computationally Intensive Research. I serve as an Associate Editor of IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems, IEEE Transactions on Cognitive and Developmental Systems, and World Scientific Annual Review of Artificial Intelligence. I was a recipient of an Amazon Research Award, an AAAI Outstanding PC Member Award, and an IEEE CIS Outstanding PhD Dissertation Award. I am a Senior Member of IEEE.
research_interest_summary: My research focuses on developing translational AI technologies for better analysing multimodal data in healthcare and beyond, particularly multidimensional data and heterogeneous graphs in bioinformatics and medical imaging. I lead the development of the PyKale library (https://github.com/pykale/pykale) to provide more accessible machine learning from multiple sources for interdisciplinary research, officially part of the PyTorch ecosystem (https://pytorch.org/ecosystem/).

title: Dr
name: Jacob Macdonald
position: Lecturer in GIS and Spatial Analysis
affiliation: Department of Urban Studies and Planning
research_areas: Humanities and Social Sciences
research_interest_terms: Data structures and algorithms, Machine learning, Safety and ethics, Social data science, Statistical methods and theory, Visualisation
short_biography: Jacob Macdonald is Lecturer in GIS and Spatial Analysis with the Dept. of Urban Studies and Planning. He completed his PhD in Economics and Finance at the Nova School of Business and Economics, and then worked as a Geographic Data Scientist with the University of Liverpool and the Geographic Data Science Lab/ Consumer Data Research Centre. His teaching and research combines applied data science, urban and environmental spatial analysis for policy and planning.
research_interest_summary: My work makes use of the increasingly available big, spatial and open datasets for research in city sciences and planning. I have a broad interest in the economic and environmental spatial processes at play in the urban context, and how they influence our observed behaviour. My work has a common theme of using data and statistical methods to explore how individuals measure, value and interact with their local built and natural environments.

title: Mr
name: Lawrence Schobs
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering, Science
research_interest_terms: Computer vision, Machine learning
short_biography: I am a third year PhD student researching medical image analysis with deep learning. I focus on landmark localization and estimating uncertainty.
research_interest_summary: computer vision, medical image analysis, landmark localization, segmentation, uncertainty estimation

title: Professor
name: Lyudmila Mihaylova
research_areas: Data-centric Engineering, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Automatic control, Computer vision, Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Multi-agent reasoning, Robotics, Statistical methods and theory
short_biography: I am a Professor in Signal Processing and Control at the Automatic Control and Systems Engineering Department, on Sheffield Robotics and Insigneo. I serve as Associate Editor-in-Chief for the IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems, a Senior Area Editor of the Signal Processing journal and as part of the organising committees of IEEE conferences on information fusion, ICASSP, conferences on intelligent transport and others.
research_interest_summary: I have broad research interests and expertise in the areas of autonomous systems with applications to cities, autonomous and assisted living systems. My recent work is in the areas of machine learning, intelligent sensing, navigation, tracking and other tasks with multi-sensor data â€“ from images and videos to time series data. Autonomous image and video analytics faces a number of challenges due to the huge volumes of data that sensors provide, the changeable environmental conditions and other factors. However, it is important to know when the methods work well and when they are not reliable, e.g. how much could we trust the obtained results? How could we quantify the impact of uncertainties on the developed solutions?

title: Dr
name: Mark Stevenson
position: Senior Lecturer in Natural Language Processing
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Human computer interface, Information retrieval, Information theory, Knowledge representation, Machine learning, Natural language processing, Optimisation, Safety and ethics, Social data science, Visualisation
short_biography: I am a Senior Lecturer in Computer Science and member of the Natural Language Processing group. I have been Principal Investigator of projects funded by a range of sources including the EPSRC, EU and Google. I have been an EPSRC Advanced Research Fellow and previously co-ordinated an EU-funded project. Before taking up my current role I worked in a range of commercial and academic organisations including Reuters Ltd (where I was involved in the production and dissemination of the widely used Reuters Corpus), Adastral Park (British Telecomâ€™s research lab) and the Center for the Study of Language and Information, Stanford University.
research_interest_summary: My research focuses on Natural Language Processing and Information Retrieval. My main interest is in the development of systems that allow users to access information contained within large collections of documents and to make decisions based on this information. To this end I have worked on a range of topics including lexical semantics, scholarly document processing, Information Extraction, plagiarism/reuse detection, Technology Assisted Review, exploratory search and evidence synthesis. I have applied these technologies to a range of areas including biomedical text mining, cultural heritage and software testing.

title: Mr
name: Mohammod Naimul Islam Suvon
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering
research_interest_terms: Computer vision, Machine learning, Natural language processing
short_biography: Mohammod Suvon completed his bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Engineering from North South University, Dhaka, Bangladesh. He has recently completed his Master's in Computer Science with speech and language processing at the University of Sheffield, UK. Currently, he is working as a research support engineer under Dr. Haiping Lu.
research_interest_summary: Mohammod Suvon's current research interest is in multimodal learning on clinical datasets.

title: Mr
name: Peizhen Bai
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering, Science
research_interest_terms: Data structures and algorithms, Information theory, Machine learning, Natural language processing, Neuroscience and cognitive science, Parallel computing
short_biography: I am a CS Ph.D. student at the University of Sheffield, supervised by Dr. Haiping Lu. My research focuses on domain transferability challenge arising from machine learning (esp. graph-based methods) adoption in real-world drug discovery. Previously, I worked at Apple Siri team as a data engineer, developing large-scale machine learned system. I am contributing to the development of open source PyKale Library and Sheffield AI Turing Network.
research_interest_summary: Deep Representation Learning, Graph Neural Networks and Knowledge Graph in Drug Discovery.

title: Dr
name: Prasun Chandra Tripathi
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering
research_interest_terms: Computer vision, Machine learning
short_biography: Prasun Chandra Tripathi received B.Tech. degree from Uttar Pradesh Technical University, Lucknow, and M.Tech. degree from University of Hyderabad, Hyderabad. He did Ph.D. degree from Indian Institute of Technology (ISM), Dhanbad, India. Currently, he is working as a Postdoc Research Associate with Department of Computer Science, University of Sheffield.
research_interest_summary: My area of interests lies in medical image analysis, deep learning, and image processing.

title: Mr
name: Rea Nkhumise
research_areas: Data-centric Engineering, Science, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Automatic control, Computer vision, Information theory, Knowledge representation, Machine learning, Multi-agent reasoning, Robotics
short_biography: I'm a robotics engineer with entrepreneurial experience, and have affinity for tackling complex problems with practical application to the general masses - hence I founded a startup company in Robotics & Software. I appreciate the interdisciplinary and system thinking approaches in applying robotics research to mitigate commonly faced societal problems.
research_interest_summary: My work is about Robotic Reinforcement Learning which aims to enable industrial robotic manipulators reach complete autonomy, through self-learning of new tasks and adapting to perturbations fast and flexibly.

title: Professor
name: Richard Clayton
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Parallel computing, Statistical methods and theory
short_biography: My undergraduate degree was in Applied Physics, followed by a PhD in Medical Physics based at the Freeman Hospital in Newcastle upon Tyne. I continued in research funded by British Heart Foundation fellowships, before moving to Sheffield Computer Science in 2003.
research_interest_summary: My research interests range from physiological signal processing through to multiscale modelling of the heart. More recently I have focussed on statistical machine learning methods for uncertainty quantification and model calibration.

title: Dr
name: Robert Turner
research_areas: Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Machine learning
short_biography: Bob is a senior research software engineer who started his career in software and databases after completing a degree in Applied Physics at the University of Durham. After four years in the private sector, he did a PhD in Biophysics at the University of Leeds, before working as a postdoc researcher at the University of Sheffield in several departments, including Physics and Astronomy, Molecular Biology and Biotechnology Mechanical Engineering and the Dental School, reflecting an unusually broad range of research interests spanning microscopy, microbiology, engineering and healthcare.
research_interest_summary:
Bobâ€™s role includes contributing to the management of the RSE team, under Paul Richmondâ€™s leadership. His work includes:

- Advising and helping researchers to implement good software engineering practises (e.g. testing, version control, documentation, reproducible execution, packaging, licensing)
- Writing research software (e.g. in Python, MATLAB, R)
- Training
- Establishing new externally-funded collaborations
- Advocating and acting to improve the standards of research software (e.g. running or delivering talks, communication via social media, engagement with university committees)

title: Mr
name: Shunbao Li
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering
research_interest_terms: Knowledge representation, Machine learning

title: Dr
name: Shuo Zhou
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering
research_interest_terms: Machine learning
short_biography:
I am an academic fellow in machine learning at the Machine Learning Research Group, Department of Computer Science, University of Sheffield.

My current research focuses on developing interpretable machine learning methods and tools for medical image analysis. I am a co-creator and core developer of open-source library PyKale, which provides a range of accessible multi-modal and transfer learning algorithms.

I serve as a reviewer of IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems and IEEE Transactions on Cognitive and Developmental Systems. I also served as a PC member of IJCAI 2022. I am an awardee of Post-Doctoral Enrichment Awards (PDEA) 2022, offered by the Alan Turing Institute.
research_interest_summary: Interpretable Machine Learning, Medical Image Analysis

title: Dr
name: Simone Croft
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering, Science, Humanities and Social Sciences, Security and Business and Public Policy, Cross-cutting Challenges
research_interest_terms: Data structures and algorithms, Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Privacy and trust, Safety and ethics, Social data science, Visualisation
short_biography: Project Manager for Data Connect, a new university wide service to improve researcher access to health and social care data.
research_interest_summary: Health and social care research

title: Mr
name: Sina Tabakhi
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Data-centric Engineering, Science
research_interest_terms: Data structures and algorithms, Information retrieval, Information theory, Machine learning, Mathematical modelling, Neuroscience and cognitive science, Statistical methods and theory
short_biography: I am a Ph.D. student in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Sheffield, working in the Machine Learning Research Group under the supervision of Dr. Haiping Lu. Before joining UoS, I had worked in the industry as a software engineer for five years, where I was in charge of developing software, bug fixing, and data visualization. I graduated with a Masterâ€™s degree as the first honor student in Computer Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, from the University of Kurdistan, supervised by Dr. Parham Moradi.
research_interest_summary: My research aims to reduce the dimensionality of big data through feature selection. Recently, I have been working on machine learning techniques to integrate multi-omics data that help design an accurate life-threatening disease diagnostic system.

title: Dr
name: Tom Stafford
position: Senior Lecturer in Psychology & Cognitive Science
research_areas: Science
research_interest_terms: Human computer interface, Multi-agent reasoning, Natural language processing, Neuroscience and cognitive science, Privacy and trust, Social data science, Visualisation
short_biography: I am also Research Practice Lead, a University-level role with responsibility for encouraging researcher engagement with better practice
research_interest_summary: I am interested in the psychology of learning, decision making and reasoning, and how these may be studied using data intensive methods  and methods from computer science

title: Dr
name: Venet Osmani
position: Senior Lecturer in Data Science for Health
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences, Science
research_interest_terms: Computer vision, Data structures and algorithms, Human computer interface, Information retrieval, Knowledge representation, Machine learning, Multi-agent reasoning, Natural language processing, Neuroscience and cognitive science, Privacy and trust, Safety and ethics, Social data science, Statistical methods and theory, Visualisation
short_biography: Before joining the University of Sheffield, I was a tenured Senior Researcher in Digital Health Centre at Fondazione Bruno Kessler research institute, Italy where I led a group of researchers and students in tackling challenges in medicine using machine learning methods. I was also a lecturer in the department of Psychology and Cognitive Science at University of Trento, Italy.
research_interest_summary:
My research interests are in developing machine learning methods, to address some of the fundamental questions in medicine. These include:

    predictive modelling
    explainable AI
    generative adversarial approaches (GAN)
    causal inference
    health inequality and bias

My work focuses on analysis of large-scale, longitudinal health records, including:

    biomarkers
    imaging
    multi-omics
    routine health care data

The main aims are to optimise treatment strategies, improve patient care, and provide novel insights to health institutions.

title: Mr
name: xulong wang
research_areas: Health and Medical Sciences
research_interest_terms: Knowledge representation, Machine learning, Mathematical modelling
